intro: Antirhea albobrunnea, commonly known as the white-brown antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically feature a combination of white and brown hues. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and can grow quite tall. Antirhea albobrunnea is often found in forest understories, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments.
